page.title: 06BRADES FARM:Farleton
page.content: A typical farm of 410 acres rearing 186 Friesian dairy cattle,300 Masham and Mule sheep,40 Charolais and Marchiagnia beef cattle.Dairy cattle graze near the farm from 1st May to mid-October and are milked twice a day in a rotary par- lour.Most milk is sold to the Milk Mar- keting Board.90 gallons per day are pasteurised and bottled on the farm and sold in Farleton,Claughton and Hornby. Sheep are bought as hogs and sold at 2 years.Beef cattle are sold at 9 months or 400kgs as stores and for slaughter.3 crops of silage a year are cut from 200 acres and stored in 2 clamps and a silo sausage Biomax bacteria improves the silage.Beet pulp and maize gluten are bought for winter and supplementary feed.Two farm cottages are let for ex- tra income.Mr Towers owns 5 tractors,a silorater,mower conditioner,muck sprea- der,slurry tanker and automatic scraper
